Under his leadership, 2M7 has funded over $100 million across 5,000+ customers, achieving a 97% approval rate. desc: 2M7 Financial Solutions is a Canadian alternative lending company founded in 2008, specializing in merchant cash advances for small and medium-sized businesses. Headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, 2M7 provides fast working capital without traditional bank requirements, offering 24-hour approval and no hidden fees. The company has funded over $100 million and served more than 5,000 customers with a 97% approval rate. 2M7 operates across all Canadian provinces except Quebec, requiring a minimum of $15,000 in monthly revenue and 3 months of business operation. The company continues to expand, recently hiring across controller, financial analyst, and systems management roles.

leaders.bg: Served as PayPal CEO from September 2023 to February 2026. Previously led Intuit's Small Business and Self-Employed Group. Under his leadership, PayPal surpassed $30B in global SMB loan originations and submitted applications to establish PayPal Bank. Replaced by former HP CEO Enrique Lores effective March 2026.
hooks: Under his watch, PayPal crossed $30B in SMB loan originations and filed for a Utah industrial bank charter

desc: LoanBuilder is PayPal's SMB lending arm, now branded as PayPal Business Loan and PayPal Working Capital. PayPal entered small business lending in 2013 with Working Capital (repaid as a percentage of PayPal sales) and expanded in 2017 with PayPal Business Loan (fixed-repayment term loans available to non-PayPal merchants). The platform was bolstered by PayPal's $183M acquisition of Swift Financial (which operated the LoanBuilder brand) in 2017. As of March 2025, PayPal has surpassed $30 billion in global loan originations, extending more than 1.4 million loans and cash advances to over 420,000 business accounts worldwide. Both products achieve exceptional Net Promoter Scores (76 and 85) with over 90% customer renewal rates. PayPal filed applications in December 2025 to establish PayPal Bank, a Utah-chartered industrial loan company, to deepen its SMB lending capabilities.

desc: ProMerchant was a Boston-based payment processing company founded in 2018 that provided credit card processing solutions to small and mid-sized merchants in retail and e-commerce. The company was acquired in August 2021 by Waitr, Inc. (a food delivery platform later rebranded as ASAP Inc.) alongside Flow Payments and Cape Cod Merchant Services. ProMerchant CLOSED on April 1, 2024. The company had offered innovative payment models including flat-rate and interchange-plus pricing. Some reports from late 2025 suggest the company may have resumed operations independently after restructuring, but its status remains unclear. Co-CEO Brett Husak subsequently founded GetPayBlox, a new payment processing venture.

desc: Beacon Funding Corporation is an equipment financing company founded in 1990, headquartered in Northbrook, Illinois. The company has facilitated over $1.7 billion in equipment financing transactions, serving more than 29,000 businesses nationwide, positioning it among the top 15% of equipment financing providers by transaction volume (per ELFA). Beacon specializes in small-ticket equipment financing with average funded amounts of $150,000, covering niche equipment including tow trucks, embroidery machines, boom trucks, screen printing equipment, and cranes. The company offers financing from $10,000 to $1,000,000+ with approval often available within 2-3 business days. Beacon Funding employs approximately 104 people and has earned multiple workplace awards including 2024 Great Place to Work certification and ranking #27 on Fortune's Best Small and Medium Workplaces in Chicago.
